turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What the fuck are we doing out here?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't know, Dignan. You went crazy.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: OK. Man in blue jeans just left by southwest door. He is entering a white van. What time is it?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: God. Isn't this great? Working on the job. Got a wheel man. Got a safecracker. Good friends with Mr. Henry.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Next week we'll be drinking pi√±a coladas.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Hopefully this trip'll go a little smoother than the last one.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Or I might end up with a broken nose.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I'll try not to hold you back tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't want to be too much of a liability.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Look, you're going to do fine. It's OK to be scared.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't think I ever said this to you. But it meant a lot to me the way you were after that Swifty stuff happened.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Bird Dog to Scarecrow. Bird Dog to Scarecrow.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Not at all. The place is totally deserted.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I've got a great view up here. I can see all the --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Check the fucking elevator. It's moving.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It was Bob. His walkie talkie's busted.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Who did that? What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It's the fire alarm. Somebody pulled the fire alarm.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Anthony. Did you lose him?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yes, there is. Let's get organized.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: So is Mr. Henry going to come by and see me or anything?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't think so. I mean. Actually, he robbed Bob's house.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You got to be kidding me.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: We haven't heard from Applejack since he got out of the hospital. His case got dismissed.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Mr. Henry never gave you a test, did he?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: We're not sure yet. It's going to need some repairs.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: So how is it in there?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What can I say? It's jail. You don't sleep when you want to. You don't eat when you want to.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I think I may have found a way out of here.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: When we go through the next gate you'll have 30 seconds to take out the tower guard.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Have the car running at the north- west checkpoint. Bob and I'll --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Scale the barricade and tunnel through no man's land. And Bob. Remember:

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Shield me from the bullets. They won't shoot civilians. Ready?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: This is my business manager, Rowboat.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It's hard to get much spin with this kind of paddle.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: It's called a racquet, Anthony, and you're holding it wrong. That's ghetto play. Hold it like this.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: You know, your form is for shit, but you've got a hell of a talent.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Every once in a while some cat comes to me. He wants to know how I made it. How did I become a success?  The first thing I tell them is: follow your instincts. Let your instincts guide you. The second thing I tell them is, for Christ's sake: you got to know your grammar.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Technique. That's right. Seventy- five percent of your job is crowd control. Seventy-five percent. Do you believe that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I'd like to live in that place. Hinckley Cold Storage.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Yeah. Convert it into lofts. OK. Pop quiz. What's the single most important aspect of your job?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Yeah. And I'll tell you who we're going to want: Kumar Banijamali.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Look at that woman. She's what? Fifty? Fifty-five? But she hasn't let herself go. I appreciate an older woman who has a commitment to her body.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Tell me something. What the hell kind of name is Dignan?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I'm not really sure. I think it's Irish. Or maybe --

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: I guess what I'm trying to say is what the hell kind of person is this Dignan?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What do you mean what kind of person? He's a good person.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Sure, sure. He's a great person, and I'd call bullshit on anybody who said differently. But I wonder if the kid has the goods  up here.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't think you're giving him enough credit. I know sometimes he doesn't think an idea through. He gets too excited. But --

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: As far as I can tell he hasn't thought his life through. He'd be fine cutting my grass or parking my car. But business?  You I can work with. You I could groom. Dignan's not going to make it.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: And you're wrong if you think, I'd turn my back on a friend.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: The Abe Henry double-cross test. You just made a perfect score.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Well, he agreed 100% that Bob should be dropped. And he also agreed you were a liability. But he felt his talent would make up for your weaknesses.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: I'll tell you, Anthony. Times like this I get philosophical. What does it mean? What's it all about? Are you afraid to die?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yeah. I mean, I don't think about it all the time. But once in awhile I kind of go, Woah. Man.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: The fear of death, The pain of consciousness.  Did you mix this martini?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Bob. Bob. That's a palindrome.  I love palindromes.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Are you afraid to die, Mr. Henry?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: I want to ask a favor, boys. One day, when I'm long gone and all but forgotten, make one last toast to Abe Henry. And remember me as a friend.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: But you're thieves. It's what you are.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Can I ask you something, Mr. Henry?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Why'd you want to help us?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Because I was like you once. And there was no one there to help me.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Future Man. You know. Cause he looks like he's from the future.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Did you ever steal a car before?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yeah. I've stolen two cars before. One Jaguar. And one Trans-Am. With T- Tops. That Trans-Am was fun to drive.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What do herbs have to do with it? I don't understand the --

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Pot is an herb. It's just like any type of gardening.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: In your backyard? How do you protect them?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's private property. Plus I have Hector.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: But he's got a loud bark. That's the most important thing is a loud bark.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know. Sure, I guess.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You could make your own cinnamon toast.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You'll probably have them the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What the fuck is Dignan doing with that cop? He loves them.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: There's a million places to hide around here.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Oh, yeah. They'll never catch the guy.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Phil probably provoked him.  Where's he going?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Why don't you just tell them the truth. Those belong to my neighbor Phil.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know. I personally don't need that shit in my life right now.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Will you guys shut up? God. It's like having two little kids in the car.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You think he got my license plates?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: How long are they going to hold him?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know anything. Except Phil says they got him. And he's in jail.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: And if Future Man doesn't get let out of jail in 48 hours, then we go back. All right?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm not playing any more golf.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Cause I'm not getting any better. It's a waste of time.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You've only been playing for two weeks, Bob. It takes a long time to learn this game.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yes. You just got to stick with it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I know it must of been a bad experience. But it doesn't sound like it was your fault.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Well, I didn't mean to electrocute him. But the whole operation was my idea.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It took six months of research. I did all the wiring myself. Switched AC to DC. Doubled the voltage. Shorted out the generator. The whole school was shut down.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's pretty complicated for a senior prank.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't like that word prank, Bob. I was trying to do something more than a prank.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: At first they were going to charge me with manslaughter. That's partly why I was in custody so long. Sixty days.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yeah. One minute you're studying Great Expectations and the next minute you're drawing the Holy Mary for some kid who tried to stab his girlfriend.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Why were you drawing the Holy Mary?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Prison tatoos. I got to be pretty good. It's not like drawing on paper.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I thought he didn't have to pay anything because of the technicality.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yeah, but he still has the aggravation. Three days sitting in a cell.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Well, because you guys don't look alike.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Let's not even talk about it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Cause you would of let my brother rot in jail.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Hopscotch. The code name is hopscotch.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, I'm having a heart attack. Of course, I'm OK. What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, I know. I'm just saying. I feel fine. You want a piece of cake?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: My walkie talkie's busted. I can't tell what's going on.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Let me see it.  Did you drop it?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: His health isn't very good, you know. They take that into account.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Right. Yeah. Yo soy dies y nueve. How old are you?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Are you ever scared of finding a dead body in one of these rooms?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It could happen. This is the exact kind of place where it happens. But I don't want to scare you.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Oh, really? That's interesting. Do you prefer Cuba or the United States?

turns.speaker: INEZ
turns.text: Does my skin feel soft, Anthony?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: God. That does sound corny. Oh, your skin feels so soft and silky. But it really kind of does.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: I hear you're a good thief.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: Did you ever hear of the S. Cooper Trust robbery?

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: S. Cooper Trust, in San Francisco?

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: I can knock a man out with a six inch punch.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: There's a lot of valuable shit in there, Applejack. The silver and the china. The crystal. And the grandfather clock. Goddammit, I bet that clock's worth ten grand.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: Why the fuck do we need to blow up the car? It doesn't make any goddamn sense.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Just settling an old score. You might say revenge.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: That sounds like a lot of bullshit that'll land us in jail.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We might have to take that chance. Cause I feel pretty strongly about this.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Looks like he's staying with Buckethead. That's what I figured. He's probably got his own room. Let's see where he's going.
